text: Włocławek is a town in northern Poland in Kuyavian-Pomeranian Voivodeship with a population of 117,785 (June 2009). It has a large Jewish community. In 1939, when the Nazis invaded, the Jewish people of this town were the first to have to wear yellow Stars of David. ==Twin Areas== This town is twinned with the following places: : Bamberg, Germany; : Bedford, United Kingdom Category:Towns in Kuyavian-Pomeranian Voivodeship
title: Włocławek
